title: 112_s1520
content: The Act titled "Pan Am Flight 103 Accountability Act of 2011" investigates terrorist attacks attributed to the government of Muammar Qaddafi. The President is required to continue investigative activities related to the bombing of Pan Am flight 103 and other terrorist attacks linked to Muammar Qaddafi. The goal is to identify and bring to justice those responsible. The President must also urge Libya's government to cooperate in these investigations. The President must consider Libya's cooperation in investigations when providing US assistance to the government. Frozen assets from Qaddafi cannot be given to Libya until full cooperation is certified. The President can waive restrictions on providing frozen assets from Qaddafi to Libya if it is in the national security interest of the United States, as long as cooperation in investigations is ensured. The President must report to Congress on investigative activities related to terrorist attacks by Muammar Qaddafi against US citizens, aiming to identify individuals involved. The President must report to Congress on efforts to identify individuals involved in terrorist attacks by Muammar Qaddafi against US citizens, including cooperation from the Transitional National Council and access to necessary persons and documents. The report will be unclassified but may have a classified annex, and the reporting requirement will end upon the President's certification. The reporting requirement on terrorist attacks by Muammar Qaddafi against US citizens will end upon the President's certification that all relevant information has been provided by the Transitional National Council or any successor government of Libya.
